jdraw.framework

Interface FigureHandle


  • public interface FigureHandle
    Handles are used to change a figure by direct manipulation. Handles know their owning figure and they provide methods to ask the handle's bounds and to track changes.
    Version:
    2.5
    Author:
    Dominik Gruntz & Christoph Denzler
    See Also:
    Figure

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(int x, int y)
      Tests if a point is contained in the handle.
      void dragInteraction(int x, int y, MouseEvent e, DrawView v)
      Tracks a step of a started interaction.
      void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws this handle.
      Cursor getCursor()
      Returns a curser which should be displayed when the mouse is over the handle.
      Point getLocation()
      Returns the location of this handle.
      Figure getOwner()
      Gets the handle's owner.
      void startInteraction(int x, int y, MouseEvent e, DrawView v)
      Tracks the start of an interaction.
      void stopInteraction(int x, int y, MouseEvent e, DrawView v)
      Tracks the end of a running interaction.

    • Method Detail

      • getOwner

        Figure getOwner()
        Gets the handle's owner.
        Returns:
        the figure which owns the handle

      • getLocation

        Point getLocation()
        Returns the location of this handle. The result depends on the location of the owning figure.
        Returns:
        location of this handle

      • draw

        void draw(Graphics g)
        Draws this handle.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to use for painting.

      • getCursor

        Cursor getCursor()
        Returns a curser which should be displayed when the mouse is over the handle. Signals the type of operation which can be performed using this handle.

        A default implementation may return Cursor.getDefaultCursor().

        Returns:
        handle's Cursor

      • contains

        boolean contains(int x,
               int y)
        Tests if a point is contained in the handle.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of mouse position
        y - y-coordinate of mouse position
        Returns:
        true, if coordinates are contained in the figure, false otherwise

      • startInteraction

        void startInteraction(int x,
                    int y,
                    MouseEvent e,
                    DrawView v)
        Tracks the start of an interaction. Usually, the position where an interaction starts is stored.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position where the interaction started
        y - the y position where the interaction started
        e - the mouse event which initiated the start interaction
        v - the view in which the interaction is performed

      • dragInteraction

        void dragInteraction(int x,
                   int y,
                   MouseEvent e,
                   DrawView v)
        Tracks a step of a started interaction.
        Parameters:
        x - the current x position
        y - the current y position
        e - the mouse event which initiated the drag interaction
        v - the view in which the interaction is performed

      • stopInteraction

        void stopInteraction(int x,
                   int y,
                   MouseEvent e,
                   DrawView v)
        Tracks the end of a running interaction.
        Parameters:
        x - the current x position
        y - the current y position
        e - the mouse event which stoped the start interaction
        v - the view in which the interaction is performed
